Adam Film World's Best Picture of the Year are the raves on the front DVD sleeve of VCX's re-release of Robert Mc Callum's SUZIE SUPERSTAR, (1984, Cal Vista) part of VCX's Cal Vista Classic DVD series. This standard frame presentation looks great and the sound is fine.

Robert McCallum directed close to 150 titles in the 1970s, 80s and 90s but more than 2/3 of these productions are from after 1985, when many xxx features switched from film to video. So, this DVD re-release should please the many who enjoyed Mc Callum's film work.

The prolific Mc Callum receives both director and cinematographer credit for SUZIE SUPERSTAR and it's a solid all-around film production that follows the exploits (and sexploits) of a fictional rock band and their lead singer, Suzie (the slender and beautiful Shauna Grant) as they unhatch a plot to get rid of their manager, Z. W. (John Leslie) who has them under a long term contract.

SUZIE SUPERSTAR opens with Suzie and band performing on stage while Z. W. drives around with a couple of groupies (strawberry blonde Gail Sterling and dark haired Laurie Smith) in the backseat. He ditches the groupies and leaves them with his driver/tough guy, Raoul (Ron Jeremy) who manages to get these gals to fuck him in the back seat.

Suzie buddies up with the old mob guy and attends his party with strippers (Asian Mai Linn is in that number) then arranges things so that the mob guy catches his daughter Priscilla with Z. W. Suzie and the gang get out of their contract thanks to some old stong-arm tactics from the mob guy.

Z. W. scouts for fresh talent and catches a performance by country singer Opan Kincaid (Sharon Mitchell) who likes what Z. W. has to offer her career then lands in the shower with her new manager.

SUZIE SUPERSTAR ends the way it begins with some sort of "fantasy' song that may or may not be lip-synched in a performance resembling those videos from the early days of M-TV, when the cable station actually played music videos around the clock.

The plot for SUZIE SUPERSTAR gets sillier as it moves along so the wonderful xxx performances of Shauna Grant and Laura Lazare that are crammed into the middle of Mc Callum's film are the main reasons to check out this DVD re-release.

Other irritants are Z. W.'s stupid golf outfits, dialog about golf that no one understands, his putting in his office.

The last 30 minutes of SUZIE SUPERSTAR is rather sparse interms of xxx action, so kudos to Mc Callum for putting so much effort into the shower scene so that SUZIE SUPERSTAR ends with a bang.

Final rating for SUZIE SUPERSTAR (1984, Cal Vista; 2008, VCX-Cal Vista Classic re-release) is !!! 1/2 outa !!!!! It's a far cry from Mc Callum's best work, something like V-The Hot One (!!!!! outa !!!!!) that blended xxx sex and story
in a fascinating way.
